claim.text: the median new single-family home in the United States offers 230 square meters
claim.claim: The median new single-family home in the United States is 230 square meters

results.summary: The claim of 230 square meters (approximately 2,476 square feet) for median new single-family home size in the US is consistent with US Census Bureau data from recent years.
results.detail: According to US Census Bureau Characteristics of New Housing data, the median size of new single-family homes completed in the US has hovered around 2,300-2,500 square feet in recent years. 230 square meters converts to approximately 2,476 square feet, which falls within this range. The exact figure varies by year - for example, 2021 showed approximately 2,273 sq ft median, while earlier years were slightly higher around 2,400+ sq ft. The 230 sqm figure is a reasonable approximation.
sources: US Census Bureau - Characteristics of New Housing (based on training knowledge, unable to verify current data via web search)
